Problem:
class HealthSystem { constructor() { this.patients = []; } addPatient(patient) { this.patients.push(patient); } treatPatient(patientName, treatment) { const patient = this.patients.find(p => p.name === patientName); if (patient) { patient.treat(treatment); } } } class Patient { constructor(name, disease) { this.name = name; this.disease = disease; this.healthStatus = 'sick'; } treat(treatment) { if (this.disease === treatment) { this.healthStatus = 'cured'; } else { this.healthStatus = 'untreated'; } } }",

If a patient's healthStatus changes to 'cured', does it necessarily mean that the patient was treated with a treatment matching their disease?
Explanation: Based on the current implementation, a patient's healthStatus changes to 'cured' only if the treatment matches the disease, meaning the correct cause (treatment) leads to this particular effect.
